content: Hi all. I am new to Zulip and also quite new to Rust. I hope it is possible to ask more knowledgeable people for help here? :)

Sure! But keep in mind that on Zulip more people are working on the compiler, language or libraries. For general "how do I do X in Rust", Discord would be better. You can still ask here, but you might get fewer answers.

Hello! I'm Max. I have discovered Rust a few months back (coming from C++), and it's still blowing my mind.
I would like to get my hands dirty contributing to rustc, making it even greater than it is already.
I am not sure where to start however, so I figured saying 'hello' on Zulip might be more productive than browsing the tickets on github on my own.
Any input appreciated :)

Hey Max! Thanks for joining :) a good place to get started is usually an E-easy, E-medium, or E-mentor issue. Alternatively you can trawl through the issues and grab one that looks interesting to you. Is there a particular part of the compiler you want to work on?
